//listing of all techniques and passes with embedded asm listings 

technique TSM3
{
    pass HBlur
    {
        vertexshader = 
            asm {
            
//
            // Generated by Microsoft (R) D3DX9 Shader Compiler 9.15.779.0000
                vs_3_0
                dcl_position v0  // IN<0,1,2,3>
                dcl_texcoord v1  // IN<4,5>
                dcl_position o0
                dcl_texcoord o1.xy
            
            #line 69 "c:\Documents and Settings\Zaknafein\My Documents\Visual Studio 2005\Projects\Bloom\Media\Shaders\GaussianBlur.fx"
                mov o0, v0  // ::VS<0,1,2,3>
                mov o1.xy, v1  // ::VS<4,5>
            
            // approximately 2 instruction slots used
            
};

        pixelshader = 
            asm {
            
//
            // Generated by Microsoft (R) D3DX9 Shader Compiler 9.15.779.0000
                ps_3_0
                def c0, 1, 0, 0, 0
                mov oC0, c0.x  // ::PS<0,1,2,3>
            
            // approximately 1 instruction slot used
            
};
    }
    pass VBlur
    {
        vertexshader = 
            asm {
            
//
            // Generated by Microsoft (R) D3DX9 Shader Compiler 9.15.779.0000
                vs_3_0
                dcl_position v0  // IN<0,1,2,3>
                dcl_texcoord v1  // IN<4,5>
                dcl_position o0
                dcl_texcoord o1.xy
            
            #line 69 "c:\Documents and Settings\Zaknafein\My Documents\Visual Studio 2005\Projects\Bloom\Media\Shaders\GaussianBlur.fx"
                mov o0, v0  // ::VS<0,1,2,3>
                mov o1.xy, v1  // ::VS<4,5>
            
            // approximately 2 instruction slots used
            
};

        pixelshader = 
            asm {
            
//
            // Generated by Microsoft (R) D3DX9 Shader Compiler 9.15.779.0000
                ps_3_0
                def c0, 1, 0, 0, 0
                mov oC0, c0.x  // ::PS<0,1,2,3>
            
            // approximately 1 instruction slot used
            
};
    }
}

                mov r0, c0.x
                mov oC0, r0  // ::PS<0,1,2,3>
